chapter.title: Chapter Eighteen
chapter.subtitle: Moksha-Samnyasyoga
chapter.description: Moksha-Samnyasyoga is taught in the eighteenth chapter. In this chapter Lord Krishna describes the true meaning of sannyasa and renunciation and the threefold quality of action.

dedication.meaning: I serve the lotus feet of the fearless one, who gives joy to the devotees

verses.Language:
Arjun Ubach
Sannyasasya Mahabaho Tattamichchami Vedatum.
1.
verses.translation: Arjuna said - O Mahabaho! O Hrishikesh! O Keshinisudana! I wish to know the theory of Sannyas and Renunciation separately.
verses.speaker: Arjuna

verses.Language:
Shri Bhagwanubach
Kamanang Karmanang Nyasong Sannyasong Kabayo Viduh.
2.
verses.translation: The Supreme Lord said - Pundits know renunciation of desirable actions as sannas and wise people call renunciation of all karmas as renunciation.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Thus the action of guilt is prahurmanishin.
3.
verses.translation: One class of thinkers say that action is sinful and therefore should be abandoned. Another class of scholars has decided that sacrifices, charity, penance etc., are forbidden.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Surely Srinu Me Tatra is Bharatasattam.
Tyago hi Purushabyagra Trividh Samprakirtita..4..
verses.translation: O Bharatasattam! Hear my sure decision about sacrifice. O male tiger! Sacrifice is also described as three types in the scriptures.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Yajnadatapakarma na tyajyong karameva tat.
Yajno Danang Tapaschaiva Pabnani Manishinam..5..
verses.translation: Yajna, charity and penance are not taboos, they must be done. Yajna, charity and penance purify even the wise.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Atanyapi Tu Karmani Sangang Tyaktba Falani f.
6.
verses.translation: O Parth! All these actions should be performed with a sense of duty, abandoning attachment and expectation of results. This is my best opinion for sure.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Niyamatsya tu Sannyasa: Karmano Noppadya.
Mohattasya Parityagastams: Parikirtit:..7..
verses.translation: But routine should not be abandoned. If his renunciation is due to delusion, it is called tamasic renunciation.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Dukhamityeva yat karma kayaklesbhayatyajet.
Sa kirtba rajsong tyagang naiva tyagaphlong levet..8..
verses.translation: One who renounces daily activities out of fear of physical suffering, finding them miserable, certainly does not attain the fruit of renunciation by renouncing that rajasik.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Karmamityeva jat karma niytang kriyateharjuna.
9.
verses.translation: O Arjuna! In my opinion, the daily activities performed out of a sense of duty by abandoning addictions and results are Sattvik.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
No Dvestyakuslang Karma Kushale Nanushajte.
Tyagi sattsamavishto meritorious fragmentation:..10..
verses.translation: Imbued with sattguna, the brilliant and the renouncer of all doubts does not abhor evil deeds and is not addicted to good deeds.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Na hi deh bhrita shakyang tyaktung karmanyashatah.
11.
verses.translation: Of course it is not possible for an embodied being to renounce all karma, but one who renounces all karma is called a real renouncer.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Anishtamishtang mishrang f trividhang karman: Falam.
Bhavatyatyaginang pretya na tu sannyasinang kakchit..12..
verses.translation: Those who have not given up their karmas will experience evil, good and mixed karmas in the next world. But monks never have to eat fruits.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Panchaitani Mahabaho Karani Nibodh May.
Sankhya Kritante Proktani Siddhaye Sarvakarnamam..13..
verses.translation: O Mahabaho! In Vedanta Shastra Siddhanta these five factors are specified for the accomplishment of all actions, know it from me.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Adhisthanang and Karta Karanang f Prithagvidham.
Vibidhashch separate effort Daibang Chaivatra panchammam..14..
verses.translation: Adhisthan means body, doer, various types of causes means senses, various efforts and Daiva means Paramatma these five causes.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Karma prarabhate Narah.
15.
verses.translation: Actions that man initiates with body, speech and mind, whether just or unjust, are the five causes.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Tatraibong sati kartarmatmanang kebelang tu yah.
16.
verses.translation: Therefore, without regard to the five causes of action, one who considers himself to be the master, due to lack of intelligence, cannot properly observe that evil.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Yasya Nahankrito Bhabo Budhiryasya Na Lipyate.
17.
verses.translation: He who has no sense of pride and whose mind is not engrossed in karma, even after killing all these creatures, he does not kill and is not bound by the karma of killing.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Gyanang Gneyang Parijnata Trividha Karmachodana.
18.
verses.translation: Jnana, gneya and parijnatha- the motivation of these three actions, Karana, Karma and Karta- the refuge of these three actions.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Jnanang Karma f Karta f Tridhiva Gunabhedatah.
Prochya is as varied as the number of gunas. 19.
verses.translation: According to the three qualities of nature, knowledge, action and action are said to be of three types. Listen to all that properly.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Sarvabhutesu is in the mood.
Abibhaktang bhagateshu tajjnanang vidhi satvikam..20..
verses.translation: The knowledge by which one undivided Chinese essence is seen in all beings, even though many living beings are different from each other but are one in essence, will know that knowledge as Sattvic.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Vaartten tu yajjnanang nanabhavan prithagvidhan.
Betti Sarveshu Bhuteshu Tajjnanang Viddhi Rajasam..21..
verses.translation: The knowledge by which one perceives that all beings possess different types of souls individually is known as Rajasika.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Jattu krishnavadeksmin kaya saktamahitaukam.
Atattvarthavadlpang ch tattamasmudhahritam..22..
verses.translation: And the knowledge by which, without knowing the real theory, attachment arises as if it is done in a particular task, that trivial knowledge is said to be tamasic knowledge.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Niytang Sangarhitmaragadveshat: Kritam.
23.
verses.translation: Sattvic Karma, which is performed without desire for fruit and without attachment, without anger and hatred.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Jattu Kamepsuna Karma Sahankaren or Re.
Kriyate Bahulayasong Tdrajasamudahritam..24..
verses.translation: But the Karma which takes great pains in the desire of the fruit and is conceited, is called Rajasika.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Anubandhang kasrang Hingsamanbekshya f Purusham.
25.
verses.translation: Actions performed out of lust without considering the consequences of future ties, loss of religious knowledge, jealousy and self-efficacy are called tamasic actions.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Muktasangohanhongvadi dhrityutsahsambinita:
Siddhyasiddhyornirbikar: Karta Sattvik Uchyate..26..
verses.translation: A doer who is free from all material attachments, devoid of ego, composed of dhrit and enthusiasm and untroubled by siddhis and siddhis is called sattvik.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Rahi Karmaphalprepsurulubdho Hinsatkatohosuchi:
Harshashokanvita: Karta Rajas: Parikirtita: ..27..
verses.translation: A Karta who is addicted to Karma, desirous of Karma, greedy, violent, impure, harsha and sorrowful, is said to be a Rajasika Karta.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Auyuga: Prakrit: Stabdha: Satho Naishkritikaholas:
Bishadee Lashsutri Ch Karta Tamas Uchyate..28..
verses.translation: A doer who is unduly active, inert, humble, harsh, insulting, lazy, melancholy and long-winded is called a tamasic doer.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Budvervedang dhriteschaiva gunatantrividhang srinu.
29.
verses.translation: O Dhananjay! Listen, I am telling you in detail and separately the threefold difference between intellect and perception according to the threefold nature of the material nature.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Encouraging f Inhibiting f Fear of action.
Bandhang Mokshang Ch Ja Betti Buddhi: Sa Partha Satviki..30..
verses.translation: O Parth! The intellect by which one can know the difference between pravritti and nivrtti, action and non-action, fear and abhaya, attachment and liberation, is Satviki.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Yaya dharmamadharmang chakarang chakaryameva f.
Inappropriate Prajanati Buddhi: Sa Partha Rajasi..31..
verses.translation: The intelligence by which the difference between religion and non-religion, action and non-action can be perceived in an unequivocal form, that intelligence is Rajasiki.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Adharmang dharmamiti which is tamasavrita in mind.
Sarvarthan Vratranscha Buddhi: Sa Partha Tamsi..32..
verses.translation: O Parth! A mind that considers adharma to be dharma and all things to be the opposite, that mind is tamasiki.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Dhritya yaya dharayat manahpranendriyakriya:
Yogenavyavicharinya Dhritti: Sa Partha Satviki..33..
verses.translation: O Parth! Abyavicharini Dhritti, which through yoga practice holds all the functions of mind, soul and senses, is Satviki.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Yaya tu dharmakamarthan dhritya dharayateharjuna.
Context: Falakangkshi Dhrithi: Sa Partha Rajasi..34..
verses.translation: O Arjuna! O Parth! The land which contains Dharma, Artha and Kama along with desire for fruits is the land of Rajasi.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Yaya swapnang voyong shokong vishadang madameb f.
Na Bimunchati Durmedha Dhriti: Sa Partha Tamsi..35..
verses.translation: O Parth! The mind that does not give up dreams, fear, grief, sorrow, alcohol, that mindless mind is Tamasi.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Sukhang tvidanimtrividhang shrnu me bharatarshav.
36.
verses.translation: O Bharatarshava! Now listen to me about the triple happiness. The closed jiva enjoys that happiness by repeated practice and by which all miseries are avoided.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Jattadgre bishamiva parinamehamritopamam.
37.
verses.translation: Bliss which is at first like poison but ultimately becomes nectar-like and springs from the purity of selfless intellect, that bliss is said to be sattvic.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Subject matter
Finally Bishamiva Tatsukhang Rajasong Smritam..38..
verses.translation: The happiness that results from the association of matter and senses, which first feels like nectar and eventually poison, is said to be rajasic.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Jadgre Chanubandhe Cha Sukhang Mohanmatman:
Nidralasyapramadotthang tattamsmudahritam.
verses.translation: The happiness which is first and last the delight of the soul and which arises from sleep, laziness and indolence, is called tamasic happiness.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
No tadasti prithibang or dibi deveshu or re.
40.
verses.translation: There is no creature in this world, among men, or among the gods in heaven, who is free from this triple nature.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Brahmin Kshatriya Bishang Shudranang Ch Parantap.
41.
verses.translation: Oh Parantap! The actions of Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas and Shudras are divided according to their inherent quality.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Shamo Damstap: Shouchong Khantirjabmeb f.
Gnanang Vigyanmastikyong Brahmakarma Swabhavajam..42..
verses.translation: Sama, Dum, Tapa, Shaucha, Kshanti, Simplicity, Knowledge, Science and Astikya - these are the natural actions of the Brahmins.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Shauryang Tejo Dhritirdakshyong was defeated in battle.
Danmishvarabhavscha kshatrang karma svabhavajam..43..
verses.translation: Bravery, brilliance, dexterity, skill, flight in battle, charity and rulership—these are the natural actions of a Kshatriya.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Agriculture and cattle trade is the nature of business.
44.
verses.translation: Agriculture, cattle rearing and trade are some of the natural activities of the Vaishyas and caring activities are the natural activities of the Shudras.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Sway sway karmanyaviratah Samsiddhing lavte narah.
Swakarmanirat: Siddhing ie Vindati Tacchrinu..45..
verses.translation: People always achieve success in their own actions. Hear how people who engage in their own actions achieve success.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Yaya pravrtivirbhutanaang as if sarvamidang tatam.
Swakarmana Tambhurchya Siddhing Bindati Manav:..46..
verses.translation: Man worships Him through his own actions, who pervades this entire world, from whom all living beings have the pre-desirous instinct.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Shreyan svadharmao viguna paradharmaat svanusthitat.
Swabhavaniyatang Karma Kurbannapnoti Kilbisham..47..
verses.translation: Swadharma performed improperly is better than Paradharma performed properly. Man does not acquire any sin by doing actions prescribed by nature.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Sahsang karma kaunteya sadoshampi na tyajet.
48
verses.translation: O Kaunteya! Instinctive actions should not be given up even if they are guilty. As fire is covered by smoke, so all actions are covered by dosha.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Asaktabuddhi: everywhere jitatma pastripha:
Naishkarmyasiddhing Paramang Sannyasenadhigachti..49..
verses.translation: A person with an intellect free from attachment to material things, a restrained mind and a desire for indulgences attains supreme siddhi in the form of Nishkarma by abandoning the form of action.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Attainment of siddhing is Brahman, Tathapanoti Nibodha Me.
Samasenaiva kaunteya nishtha jnanasya which wears..50..
verses.translation: O Kaunteya! Listen to me in brief how the Jiva attains Brahman, the devotional form of knowledge, by attaining Nishkarma Siddhi.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Buddhya Visudhya Yukto Dhrityatmanang Nimya f.
शबदादिन्विशांस्त्यक्ट्व रागद्वेशु व्युदस्य f..51..
verses.translation: Being pure-minded, the mind is controlled by Dhritti, words abandon the original sense-matters, anger and hatred.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Viviktasevi Laghvashi Jatbakkayamanas:
Dhyanayogaparo nityang vairagyang samupasrit:..52..
verses.translation: Lives in seclusion, eats little food, restrains body, mind and speech, always takes refuge in Vairagya coupled with meditation.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Ahankarang balang darpong kamang krodhang parigraham.
Vimuchya Nirmam: Shanto Brahmabhuaya Kalpate..53..
verses.translation: Completely freed from pride, force, desire, lust, anger, attachment, the calm man devoid of compassion attains Brahman-realization.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Brahmabhuta: Prasannatma neither sorrow nor longing.
Samah sarveshu bhuteshu madbhakting lavte param..54..
verses.translation: A person who is contented with Brahman does not grieve or long for anything. He received my devotion by observing all living beings.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Bhaktya Mamvijanati Yavanyashasmi Tatvatah.
Thato mang tatto jnatva bishte tadnantaram..55..
verses.translation: Only by devotion can one theoretically know Me as I am. Knowing Me through this kind of devotion, he can then enter My abode.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Sarvakarmanyapi Sada Kurbano Madvyapashray:
Matprasadadvapnoti shasvatang padamvyam..56..
verses.translation: My pure devotee always attains Nitya Abaya Dham in My Prasad despite doing all the Karmas.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Chetsa sarvakarmani moi sannyasya matparah.
57.
verses.translation: By the intellect entrusting all actions to Me, being sober, taking refuge in Buddha-yoga, always be drunken-minded.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Macchitta: Sarvadurgani Matprasadattarishyasi.
Atha Chettamahankaranna Sroshyasi Vinakshyasi..58..
verses.translation: If you are thus intoxicated, you will overcome all obstacles to my prasadam. But if you do not listen to me out of pride, you will perish.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Yadahankara masritya na yotsya iti manyase.
59. Nature-based employment in fake business.
verses.translation: If you harbor pride and think 'I will not fight', then your resolve will be false. Because your nature will incline you to war.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Svabhavajen kaunteya focused: sven karmana.
60
verses.translation: O Kaunteya! Of course you don't want to fight now, but you will naturally be inclined to do so because of your own natural actions.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Ishwar: Sarvabhuthanang Hriddesheharjun Tishti.
Vhramayan sarvabhutani yantrarudhani maya..61..
verses.translation: O Arjuna! The Supreme Lord resides in the heart of all living beings and makes all living beings travel by maya by ascending the physical body.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Tameb Sharanang Gachch Sarvabhaben Bharat.
62.
verses.translation: O India! Take full refuge in Him. In His prasad you will attain peace and everlasting abode.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Iti te Gnanamakhitang Guhyad Guhyatarang Maya.
63.
verses.translation: This is how I explained to you the most profound knowledge. You judge it completely and do what you want.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Sarvaguhyatamang Bhuyah Shrnu May Paramang Bachah.
Ishtohsi me thammiti tato bakshyami te hitam..64..
verses.translation: You hear from me the most secret supreme advice. Since you are very dear to me, I am speaking for your sake.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Manmana bhava madbhakto madyaji mang namaskuru.
Mamevaishyasi satyang te pratijane priyohsi me..65..
verses.translation: You devote your heart to me, become my devotee, worship me and offer salutations to me. Then you will be very dear to me.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Renunciation of all religions
Ahang thang sarvapapevyo mokshayyyami ma shuch:..66..
verses.translation: Abandon all forms of religion and take refuge only in Me. I will free you from all sins. don't you mourn
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Idong te Natapskaya Nabhaktaye Kadachan.
No chashushrushbe bachyong no cha mang johavyasuati..67..
verses.translation: Those who are intemperate, disobedient, careless and hateful to Me, should never be told this secret knowledge.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Ya idang paramang guhyang madbhaktesvabhidasati.
Bhakting moi parang kirtba mamevaishyatsamshay:..68..
verses.translation: He who preaches this supremely secret hymn among my devotees will undoubtedly return to me with the devotion of the para.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
No Ch Tasmanmanusyeshu Kaschinme Priyakrittam:
Bhabita na cha me tasmadanya: Priyataro Bhubi..69..
verses.translation: There is no one dearer to me than him among people in this world and no one will be dearer to me than him.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Presided over by Ch Ya Imang Dharmyang Sangambayo:
Gnanyajnen Tenahmishta: Samiti Me Mati:..70..
verses.translation: And whoever studies this holy conversation between us, I will be worshiped by that knowledge sacrifice. This is my opinion.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Shraddhabanasuyasch shrinuadapi yo narah.
Sohpi mukta: shubhallokan prapnuatpunyakarmanam..71..
verses.translation: A man who listens to the Gita with respect and without envy, he also becomes free from sin and obtains the auspicious people of virtuous workers.
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Kacchidetat sratanga partha tvaikagrena chetsa.
Kacchidjnanasammoha: Pranastaste Dhananjaya..72..
verses.translation: O Parth! O Dhananjay! Have you listened to this Gita with concentration? Has your unconscious infatuation been dispelled?
verses.speaker: the supreme

verses.Language:
Arjun Ubach
Nasto moha: Smritirlabdha Tattprasadamanayachyuta.
73.
verses.translation: Arjuna said - O Achyuta! All my doubts were cleared and settled in wisdom. Now I will obey your command.
verses.speaker: Arjuna

verses.Language:
Sanjay Ubach
Ityahang Vasudevasya Parthasya c Mahatmanah.
Sangammimamshroumadbhutang romharshanam..74..
verses.translation: Sanjay said - This is how I heard this strange and thrilling news of Krishna and Arjuna.
verses.speaker: Sanjay

verses.Language:
Vyasaprasadachrutbanetd guhyamhang param.
Yoga Yogeswarat Krishnatsakshatkathayat: Swayam..75..
verses.translation: By the grace of Vyasadeva, I heard from Yogeswara Sri Krishna himself the narrator of this supremely secret yoga encounter.
verses.speaker: Sanjay

verses.Language:
Rajan Samsmritya Samsmritya Sangammimamadbhutam.
Keshbarjunyo: Punyang Hrishyami Ch Muhurmuhu:..76..
verses.translation: O King! Again and again I am thrilled to recall this auspicious strange news of Krishna and Arjuna.
verses.speaker: Sanjay

verses.Language:
Tacha Samsmritya Samsmritya Rupamatyadbhutang Hare:
Bishmayo May Mahan Rajan Hrishyami Ch Repeat Repeat..77..
verses.translation: O King! Remembering that very strange form of Lord Krishna, I am greatly awestruck and thrilled again and again.
verses.speaker: Sanjay

verses.Language:
Jatra Yogeswara: Krishna Jatra Partho Dhanurdhar:
Tatra Srirvijayo Bhutirdhruva Nitirmatirmam..78..
verses.translation: Where Yogeswara is Sri Krishna and where Dhanurdhar is Partha, there surely exists Sri, Victory, tremendous power and principle. That is my opinion.
verses.speaker: Sanjay

summary.title: Eighteenth Chapter - Moksha-Samnyasyoga
summary.description: Moksha-Samnyasyoga is taught in this chapter. Lord Krishna describes the true meaning of sannyasa and renunciation and the threefold quality of action. He explained that through Bhakti Yoga one can attain supreme liberation by taking refuge in God.
keyThemes: The theory of asceticism and renunciation
